name: Wo Hop Restaurant
tagline: The iconic restaurant in New York City's Chinatown since 1938

sections.title: Our History
sections.body:
Since 1938, Wo Hop has been serving authentic Chinese cuisine in the heart of New York City's Chinatown. We're proud to be one of the oldest restaurants in the neighborhood, continuing the tradition of serving delicious, affordable meals to locals and visitors alike.

Our family-owned restaurant has been passed down through generations, maintaining the same recipes and commitment to quality that made us a Chinatown institution. We specialize in traditional Cantonese dishes, American-Chinese favorites, and authentic regional specialties.

sections.title: Award-Winning Cuisine
sections.body:
In 2022, Wo Hop was honored to receive the James Beard Foundation America's Classics Award, recognizing our contribution to American culinary culture. This prestigious award celebrates restaurants that have been serving their communities for decades while maintaining their original character and quality.

Our menu features time-tested recipes that have delighted customers for over 80 years, from our famous chop suey to our authentic dim sum and traditional Cantonese dishes.

reviews.text: Amazing authentic Chinese food! The chop suey is incredible and the service is always friendly. A true Chinatown gem.
reviews.author: Sarah M.

reviews.text: Been coming here for years. The food is consistently great and the prices are very reasonable. Love the old-school atmosphere.
reviews.author: Mike L.

reviews.text: Best Chinese restaurant in Chinatown! The portions are huge and everything tastes fresh. Highly recommend the dumplings.
reviews.author: Jennifer K.
